org.openimaj.video.processing.motion

Class MotionEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.Video<T>
      • org.openimaj.video.processor.VideoProcessor<T>
        • org.openimaj.video.analyser.VideoAnalyser<FImage>
          • org.openimaj.video.processing.motion.MotionEstimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<FImage>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GridMotionEstimator

    public abstract class MotionEstimator
extends VideoAnalyser<FImage>
    A motion estimator will estimate the motion of parts of a video frame. This class includes a set of algorithms for calculating the motion estimation.

    This class deals with the buffering of frames from the video which to pass to the motion estimation. The class is abstract and the method estimateMotionField(MotionEstimatorAlgorithm, VideoFrame, VideoFrame[]) must be overridden by an implementing class to provide the field over which the motion estimation will take place. This field may, for example, be a grid or an overlapping grid. This overridden method must also determine the appropriate way to call the motion estimation algorithm while returning a map which maps a point to a displacement vector.

    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
